intro: Astragalus hekmat-safaviae, commonly known as the Hekmat-Safavia milkvetch, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family Fabaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia, particularly in Afghanistan and Pakistan. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. Its leaves are typically trifoliate, consisting of three small, oval-shaped leaflets. Astragalus hekmat-safaviae is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, with deep root systems that help it access water from deeper soil layers.
